# SSLProtocol

**Enumeration**

An enumeration of valid SSL protocol versions.

## Declaration

```swift
enum SSLProtocol
```

## Overview

The descriptions given here apply to the functions [doc://com.apple.security/documentation/Security/SSLSetProtocolVersion] and [doc://com.apple.security/documentation/Security/SSLGetProtocolVersion]. For the functions [doc://com.apple.security/documentation/Security/SSLSetProtocolVersionEnabled] and [doc://com.apple.security/documentation/Security/SSLGetProtocolVersionEnabled], only the following values are used. For these functions, each constant except [doc://com.apple.security/documentation/Security/SSLProtocol/sslProtocolAll] specifies a single protocol version.

- [doc://com.apple.security/documentation/Security/SSLProtocol/sslProtocol2]
- [doc://com.apple.security/documentation/Security/SSLProtocol/sslProtocol3]
- [doc://com.apple.security/documentation/Security/SSLProtocol/tlsProtocol1]
- [doc://com.apple.security/documentation/Security/SSLProtocol/sslProtocolAll]

## SSL Protocols

- **SSLProtocol.sslProtocolUnknown**: Specifies that no protocol has been or should be negotiated or specified; use default.
- **SSLProtocol.sslProtocol2**: Specifies that only the SSL 2.0 protocol may be negotiated. Deprecated in iOS.
- **SSLProtocol.sslProtocol3**: Specifies that the SSL 3.0 protocol is preferred; the SSL 2.0 protocol may be negotiated if the peer cannot use the SSL 3.0 protocol.
- **SSLProtocol.sslProtocol3Only**: Specifies that only the SSL 3.0 protocol may be negotiated; fails if the peer tries to negotiate the SSL 2.0 protocol. Deprecated in iOS.
- **SSLProtocol.sslProtocolAll**: Specifies all supported versions. Deprecated in iOS.

## TLS Protocols

- **SSLProtocol.tlsProtocol1**: Specifies that the TLS 1.0 protocol is preferred but lower versions may be negotiated.
- **SSLProtocol.tlsProtocol1Only**: Specifies that only the TLS 1.0 protocol may be negotiated. Deprecated in iOS.
- **SSLProtocol.tlsProtocol11**: Specifies that the TLS 1.1 protocol is preferred but lower versions may be negotiated.
- **SSLProtocol.tlsProtocol12**: Specifies that the TLS 1.2 protocol is preferred but lower versions may be negotiated.
- **SSLProtocol.tlsProtocol13**: Specifies that the TLS 1.3 protocol is preferred but lower versions may be negotiated.
- **SSLProtocol.tlsProtocolMaxSupported**: The maximum system supported version.

## DTLS Protocols

- **SSLProtocol.dtlsProtocol1**: Specifies the DTLS 1.0 protocol.
- **SSLProtocol.dtlsProtocol12**: Specifies the DTLS 1.2 protocol.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
